**Lionel Messi has previously admitted that Barcelona players "hated" a Premier League club more than bitter rivals Real Madrid – and it was something he "never thought" he would say.**

The Argentine was only a teenager when he decided to go public with the comments during an interview with the News of the World in 2005.

At the time, there was bad blood between [Barcelona](https://www.sportbible.com/barcelona) and [Chelsea](https://www.sportbible.com/chelsea) after the Blues produced a memorable comeback at Stamford Bridge in what was a dramatic Champions League last-16 clash.

Advert

A week earlier, [Jose Mourinho](https://www.sportbible.com/jose-mourinho) made some not-so-subtle comments about referee Anders Frisk after Didier Drogba was controversially sent off in the first leg.

The two-legged clash left a bitter taste in the mouth of Barcelona players. In fact, ahead of their last-16 clash in 2006, an 18-year-old [Messi](https://www.sportbible.com/lionel-messi) was vocal about Chelsea.

"There are \[Barcelona\] players here who hate Chelsea more than [Real Madrid](https://www.sportbible.com/real-madrid)," he said.

Advert

"I never thought I would hear myself say that. I also never thought I would see something worse than the Boca and River Plate rivalry or Brazil vs Argentina - but this is.

"We would rather play Arsenal, [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd) or anyone else than be on the pitch with Chelsea."

Messi would go on to produce a superb display for the Catalan side, despite being hacked down by Chelsea defender Asier Del Horno, who was sent off for a shocking challenge on the Argentine.

An own goal from John Terry and a late strike from Samuel Eto'o sealed a first leg advantage before they knocked Jose Mourinho's side out following a 1-1 draw at the Camp Nou.

Advert

Barca would lift the [Champions League](https://www.sportbible.com/champions-league) that year after Juliano Belletti scored a late winner at the Stade de France against Arsenal.

![Image 1: Image credit: Getty ](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltb6fe9d998cb97366/67473717bc09f122b0a85c1b/GettyImages-56910229_(1).jpg)

Image credit: Getty

Messi later recalled a 2012 Champions League defeat to Chelsea as being one of his biggest regrets in a Barcelona shirt.

“I would have liked to have tried to win another Champions League," he said in 2021, when he announced his decision to leave Barca.

Advert

“We got knocked out in the semi-final's by Liverpool which stopped us getting to another final. We got to the semi-final with Chelsea with Pep \[Guardiola\], they prevented us from getting to another final.

1.  **Simon Stone**  
    Chief football news reporter
    
    ![Image 22: Jonny Evans of Man Utd](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/00fc/live/d9633fb0-acd0-11ef-9567-e3ed3a4de1fc.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    New Manchester United coach Ruben Amorim has an unusual way of singling out players when he is making generic points.
    
    He did it on Sunday when he spoke about his players having difficulties adapting to his new system, pointing to an instance when Jonny Evans found himself in the wrong place.
    
    Today in his news conference, Amorim explained he was using Evans to emphasise the point he was making rather than being critical.
    
    A couple of answers later, he was talking about players needing to score goals and said Amad Diallo needs to be better at it.
    
    This is good, but it is also a bit dangerous because at some point the subtlety might be lost and it will come across as a direct criticism, which it isn't.
    
    Then, it will turn into a storm he then has to deal with when he next speaks to the media.
    
    *   [Not a Man Utd fan? Check in on your club's page here](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/articles/cn8gp7evvg3o)
        
    
    ![Image 23: An image detailing how to follow your Premier League team on BBC Sport: "On the app? Tap the bell icon to get news about your club sent to you. Signed in on a browser? Hit 'Follow' to stay up to date.](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/3a8e/live/3f0326b0-08a2-11ef-b9d8-4f52aebe147d.jpg.webp)
    
2.  [Advertisement](https://www.bbc.com/usingthebbc/cookies/)
    
3.  ![Image 24: Bruno Fernandes playing for Manchester United](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/4349/live/11569ba0-acc8-11ef-9567-e3ed3a4de1fc.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes says he is confident of fitting in to Ruben Amorim's new system at Old Trafford.
    
    His fellow countryman is the third permanent manager Fernandes has played under since signing for the Red Devils in 2020, plus nine months under interim Ralf Rangnick.
    
    "You always have to adapt to different ideas and positions, even sometimes playing in the same system you have to adapt to different ideas of playing," said Fernandes before Thursday's Europa League game against Norwegian champions Bodo/Glimt.
    
    "It is not difficult for me to adapt in any position. I am really well aware of that.
    
    "During training I try to absorb everything, from every position. I try to have an understanding of the game because being the captain, the manager cannot always give the message from the bench to the pitch. As captain, you have to try to resolve the situation together with your team-mates. Having knowledge of every position is my role."
    
    Fernandes has four goals and two assists in his past five games in all competitions in November after initially struggling for goal contributions at the start of the season. He is confident he will settle quickly into Amorim's tactical setup.
    
    "I think \[adapting to the system\] could probably be worse for the younger players - I know what the Sporting players were doing very well," he added. "Not because I was reading what the manager was doing, but because I was watching their games!
    
    "We are international players. Every time you go to the national team, you probably play in a different system. With Portugal, we sometimes play with a back three. I've had that experience of the manager's formation already."
    
4.  [### 14:58Amorim wants Rashford to show desire to peak again, published at 14:58Amorim wants Rashford to show desire to peak again](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/articles/c2dl62ezwn1o)
    
    *   Attribution
        
        [Man Utd](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/teams/manchester-united)
        
    
    ![Image 25: Marcus Rashford in Manchester United kit](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/480/cpsprodpb/4caa/live/3f722070-acca-11ef-9567-e3ed3a4de1fc.jpg)
    
5.  **Josh Lobley**  
    BBC Sport Journalist
    
    Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim has been speaking to the media before Thursday's Europa League game against Bodo/Glimt.
    
    Here are the key lines from his news conference:
    
    *   He was asked if Harry Maguire and Lisandro Martinez will be available for Thursday's match: "Not Harry. Lisandro is ready. I felt he's had enough time so he is ready. Harry will be ready soon and on the pitch also."
        
    *   On fellow defender Lenny Yoro's availability: "He is available to train but we are working on his fitness, which is important. He is a young guy. We believe in him a lot and we are trying to prepare the best way."
        
    *   On his first match at Old Trafford: "Everybody has said it will be a special time. Before the match it will be like a new sensation, but after the whistle it will be one more game and we want to win that match."
        
    *   Amorim confirmed that there will be squad rotation for Thursday's match: "We have to do it, especially in this moment because we have a lot of games. We are in the beginning of something. They have to feel that they are part of the team."
        
    *   On Thursday's opponents: "I'm expecting a very good team, they can win the \[Norwegian\] league this week. They run a lot and that is a very good thing for us because we need to improve that. They have some special players on the wings and they can play in the pockets very well."
        
    *   Amorim was asked if he will ever change his formation: "We have to do it. When I talk about our structure, I believe we can play in different systems. Nowadays, every team changes their dynamic so we will adapt to that. Right now, we are starting with the beginning and after that we will change different things."
        
    *   On the lack of goalscorers in recent years: "Of course there is a concern, but we have to improve as a team. But we have quality players who can score lots of goals. Rasmus \[Hojlund\] Joshua \[Zirkzee\] and Rashford will score more goals."
        
    *   On helping Rashford find his best form: "I will try to help him. It wasn't the best position for him \[against Ipswich\], we will try to find the right solution for him. He has to be the first one to really want it."

6.  **Pat Nevin**  
    Former footballer and presenter
    
    ![Image 27: Ruben Amorim, Head Coach of Manchester United, reacts during the Premier League match between Ipswich Town FC and Manchester United FC at Portman Road](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/e2a0/live/7b0aa8c0-abd3-11ef-ab35-97bc121df147.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    After [Liverpool's](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool) win at [Southampton](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/southampton), all eyes shifted to the real story on Sunday. Ruben Amorim’s first decisions as Manchester United coach are as much discussed in the UK as Donald Trump’s White House cabinet selections attract attention over the pond.
    
    ‌Certainly, United now have a plan, but whether it is a good one that suits the players is less certain. The identity of a harder working, energetic side has already been demanded by the new coach. The suspicion is that he will need a lot of action in the transfer market rather than the training ground to achieve this.
    
    ‌The fact that they were not demonstrably better than promoted [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town), after a fabulous start, shows the road is long, and he will need some time, probably quite a lot.
    
    ‌Will it be a match made in heaven? It has more chance than Steve Cooper had at [Leicester](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/leicester-city). If ever there was a poisoned chalice, this was it for the former [Nottingham Forest](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/nottingham-forest) manager, that was a union doomed to failure.

7.  **Dale O'Donnell**  
    Fan writer
    
    ![Image 28: Manchester United fan's voice banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/d13f/live/f1ac4610-3b6c-11ee-bde6-7ffba94c56ae.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 29: Amad Diallo plays for Manchester United at Ipswich](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/aafe/live/0cc6cf90-aca2-11ef-80a8-1d72d6de619d.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Amad Diallo has been working his way into Manchester United’s plans, but now is the time for the winger to stake his importance to Ruben Amorim.
    
    Last Sunday, we saw Amad deployed as one of two wing-back options in the 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town.
    
    Amorim had just two training sessions with his matchday squad to prepare his players for their first game.
    
    The Portuguese coach wasted no time implementing his preferred 3-4-3 formation, with Diogo Dalot named as the opposite wing-back.
    
    After the first two minutes, I thought ‘right, this is clicking instantly’ as Amad went on a sublime driving solo run down the right flank before setting up Marcus Rashford with a brilliant cross.
    
    The end result didn’t go United’s way but this was an instant example of the damage Amad can inflict in wide areas as he beat two Ipswich players on his travels.
    
    When I watch United, I want our wide players hurting teams down the flanks, and Amad has the energy to be a threat throughout games. That is why Amorim will have a place for the 22-year-old.
    
    As a wing-back, Amad is also expected to carry out defensive duties, and he was kept busy in that department at Portman Road with 71 touches of the ball. He won five of his eight duels and made five clearances against the Tractor Boys.
    
    Amad could be used as a number 10 in Amorim’s system – alongside Bruno Fernandes – as he has energy in abundance to carry out that role if required, as seen during his stint at Sunderland under Tony Mowbray.
    
    The Ivory Coast international has been knocking on the door at United for some time, but he deserves the opportunities he’s got this season.
    
    After a match-winning display against PAOK in the Europa League earlier this month, there is reason to believe Amad will become an important player under Amorim at United.
    
    Further proof that hard work pays off.

12.  **Alex Turk**  
    Fan writer
    
    ![Image 42: Manchester United fan's voice banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/d13f/live/f1ac4610-3b6c-11ee-bde6-7ffba94c56ae.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 43: Ruben Amorim crouches on the touchline during Manchester United's game at Ipswich](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/012c/live/6ad04300-ab58-11ef-9323-7924a1e1d563.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Why did Manchester United not look as good as Sporting against [Ipswich Town](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) on Sunday? Can this Ruben Amorim fella walk the walk as well as he talks the talk? How is this 3-4-3 system going to click?
    
    Those would be questions of an individual needing to understand the reality of the situation Amorim has inherited from Erik ten Hag.
    
    Such a drastic change of vision would have been challenging to instil with a full pre-season at his disposal. United visited Portman Road with two training sessions in the tank.
    
    Amorim understands that only wins will buy him time, but that has not deterred his repeated cries for patience.
    
    As long as he persists with his three-at-the-back philosophy and his guarantee of a clear identity - something United have missed for far too long - supporters will offer the patience he desires.
    
    Not much sense is required to understand why the Red Devils did not enjoy a winning start to life under Amorim at Ipswich.
    
    It was simple. The 3-4-3 formation was present, unlike the profile of player that made his tactics so effective in Portugal.
    
    Amorim's high-octane demands are not built for a 36-year-old operating as a left-sided centre-back and two midfielders aged 32 powering the engine room.
    
    United lacked legs in defence and midfield - already a known issue - and efficient decision-making in attack - also no surprise.
    
    Amorim cannot be judged this early on.
    
    I loved his post-match quote about staying true to his plan, regardless of the squad at his disposal, rather than adapting his methods in search of short-term results.
    
    Ten Hag opted for the latter, ultimately prompting the arrival of the sixth permanent boss since Sir Alex Ferguson after a predictable plight.
    
    This time around, the focus should be on short-term pain for long-term gain.

18.  ![Image 51: Chief football writer Phil McNulty byline banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/55a5/live/13026c10-3aa7-11ef-bbe0-29f79e992ddd.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 52: Manchester United's Portuguese head coach Ruben Amorim (L) shakes hands with Manchester United's Cameroonian goalkeeper #24 Andre Onana (R) at the end of the English Premier League football match between Ipswich Town and Manchester United at Portman Road](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/e00e/live/579abfe0-ab44-11ef-8ab9-9192db313061.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    **BBC Sport's chief football writer Phil McNulty has been answering your questions.**
    
    **Mike asked:** Manchester United may 'only' be six points off fourth place, but there are a lot of teams in between. Clearly not all teams above are going to drop more points than United do. I feel we should stop focusing on fourth place and focus on improvement for next season. Where we finish is where we finish.
    
    I don't know if it is instant gratification or a lack of knowledge among many fans, but (tell me if I am wrong) a new coach does not simply say: 'Now we set up like this, you play this position and problem solved'. It takes a lot of time and practice to replace old ways and habits with new ones.
    
    I say we need to be patient and judge it in the new season. What is your take on whether Manchester United are likely to improve?
    
    **Phil answered:** These are all very good points and Ruben Amorim made a lot of them himself after the draw at Ipswich Town, when he pointed out that Manchester United will have to "suffer" while he implements his tactical tweaks, saying it was worth risking things tactically now to feel the benefit next season.
    
    So yes, patience will be needed and, in my experience, Manchester United fans are remarkably patient with their managers.
    
    What we have seen from Amorim already is a clear identity in terms of how he wants to play and a clear idea of his strategy. I don't think we ever really saw that from Erik ten Hag.
    
    I think United will improve – and I wouldn't write off fourth place either, because I really believe that slot is wide open – but it will take time and patience, and there will be bumps along the way.
    
19.  [### 14:26 25 NovemberSheeran sorry for interrupting Amorim interview, published at 14:26 25 NovemberSheeran sorry for interrupting Amorim interview](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/articles/cyv7zgj0l52o)

    ![Image 53: Ed Sheeran at Ipswich Town ](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/480/cpsprodpb/551d/live/b20d9400-ab37-11ef-8d14-b38ce06af7f3.jpg)
    
20.  ![Image 55: Ruben Amorim crouches on touchline during match](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/91ba/live/8b2c9540-ab21-11ef-8487-d5a0de19ffaf.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Manchester United's new formation may have to "evolve into something else" if they are going to being competitive in the Premier League, says former [Liverpool](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool) midfielder Danny Murphy.
    
    New boss Ruben Amorim used his favoured formation of three at the back in his first game in charge against [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) on Sunday.
    
    It was an unfamiliar set-up for the backline and, despite United taking an early lead within two minutes, they ultimately drew 1-1 against the newly promoted side.
    
    "I would be amazed if they are still playing a 3-4-3 in a year's time," Murphy said on Match of the Day 2.
    
    "This league is very, very different than continental leagues. We have only had [Chelsea](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea) in recent years win playing that system. And, let's be honest, they had Kante and Matic - two wonderful midfielders in the middle of the pitch, plus Costa up top with Hazard supporting him and helping them as well.
    
    "They \[Manchester United\] don't have those players yet and how do you find them? It costs hundreds of millions to get the best players in the world.
    
    "When you play three at the back against the majority of good teams in our league who play three high, you end up being a five and that is really difficult.
    
    "If Manchester United are going to become much better and be competitive, I think that 3-4-3 will evolve into something else."
    
    [Watch the full discussion on BBC iPlayer](https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/m0025f6r/match-of-the-day-2-202425-24112024)
    
21.  ![Image 56: Your views banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/2f7f/live/95709000-0915-11ef-bee9-6125e244a4cd.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 57: Luke Shaw of Manchester United battles for possession with Omari Hutchinson of Ipswich Town](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/39c4/live/f4a5c660-aaa7-11ef-821d-af5442865c2a.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    We asked for your thoughts after Sunday's Premier League game between Ipswich Town and Manchester United, which ended in a 1-1 draw.
    
    Here are some of your comments:
    
    **Ipswich towns**
    
    **Matt**: I thought we looked like a proper Premier League team. We were better than Manchester United. This line-up is definitely our strongest 11 (apart from the absent Greaves). If we continue to play like this we will stay up. Omari was outstanding.
    
    **James**: This was another step in the right direction for Town, with a fully deserved point. It was frustrating to concede so early, as we were the team in the ascendancy in the first half, which was capped by a superb goal by Omari Hutchinson. There wasn't much between the two sides in the second half and we again showed our resilience to see out the draw.
    
    **Michael**: Wonderful performance by Town after what some would say is our regular early mistake. We battled well and had we won the game it would not have been an injustice. Credit should also go to the referee, Anthony Taylor, who allowed the game to flow and kept control throughout.
    
    **Phillip**: We more than matched a top team in the Premier League/ Europe. We probably should have got all three points. We have to believe in this fantastic team of ours because we were brilliant, as we were at T[ottenham](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/tottenham-hotspur). We are building something special. Kieran McKenna, what can I say, amazing achievement. Absolutely buzzing.
    
    **United fans**
    
    **Mike58**: Obviously disappointed not to win but a draw was the least Ipswich deserved. Signs of life to come - a manager/coach with tactical knowledge and an identity. He will improve these players, for sure. Having had only days to work with these players he has overachieved. Onana clear player of the match for United.
    
    **Mark**: Early days but the same old problems resurfaced and we need to stop giving the ball away cheaply. We bossed the second half and deserved the win, but the cutting edge is still missing up front and we should be more clinical. Hopefully Amorin will iron these problems out and we will improve - slowly but steadily.
    
    **Toni**: Wasn't expecting miracles, to be honest. Amorim has a lot of work to do. However, some players can be moved on in January. We cannot and must not have a squad of uninterested professionals. A draw was good enough but we need more effort.
    
    **Davos**: A steady start for Amorim. He has plenty of work to do to get the boys firing on all cylinders. The midfield seemed a little slow at times and we just need a striker to be in the box for when the ball is played into that area as both Zirkzee and Hojlund look lost. Onwards and upwards.
    
    ![Image 58: An image detailing how to follow your Premier League team on BBC Sport: "On the app? Tap the bell icon to get news about your club sent to you. Signed in on a browser? Hit 'Follow' to stay up to date.](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/51a6/live/913754d0-476b-11ef-96a8-e710c6bfc866.jpg.webp)
    
22.  **Simon Stone**  
    Chief football news reporter
    
    ![Image 59: Monday's news paper back pages](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/0916/live/73b44a40-ab0b-11ef-bdf5-b7cb2fa86e10.jpg.webp)Image source, Mirror and Star
    
    Image caption,
    
    Monday's papers focus on Amorim's view his players will "suffer" in order to progress
    
    Ruben Amorim asked Manchester United's hierarchy if he could join the club in the summer rather than in mid-season.
    
    United said no.
    
    It is different owners calling the shots at Old Trafford now but their memories wouldn't have to be long to recall the issues created by Ralf Rangnick's ill-fated stint as interim.
    
    Their reasoning for wanting Amorim now are sound.
    
    Similarly, Amorim is one of the most highly rated young coaches in Europe. United chief executive Omar Berrada is a big fan. Going after him also made sense.
    
    The problem is having made the calls, United are now in a position where the new coach is trying to implement a new playing style, knowing there are too many midweek matches looming to allow proper training on shape and positioning, which may lead to unexpected defeats.
    
    As a club, they cannot afford to just toss away seasons as part of a big rebuild. That is not the idea behind bringing someone in like Amorim.
    
    But, at best, it is a calculated gamble.
    
    United dropped two points at Portman Road. They remain in the bottom half of the table. That situation needs to change.
    
    ![Image 60: Monday's newspaper back pages](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/8ea9/live/578e53b0-ab0b-11ef-a4fe-a3e9a6c5d640.jpg.webp)Image source, Daily Express and Guardian
    
23.  ![Image 61: Ruben Amorim ](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/1b47/live/36ed8ac0-ab08-11ef-b429-5b139d1e7a7e.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Former Premier League striker Glenn Murray is confident that Manchester United's performances under Ruben Amorim "will only get better" but believes the new boss will be working on the fitness of his players.
    
    Amorim kicked-off his tenure on Sunday with a draw at [Ipswich Town](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town), leaving United 12th in the Premier League.
    
    "Anyone at Manchester United should be good enough to fall into a different system under any manager," said Murray on the BBC Radio 5 Live Football Daily podcast. "I am glad that he lined the team-up in the way he wanted as 3-4-3 is his identity and I am sure it will only get better.
    
    "One thing I noticed is that he is not happy with their physicality. He wants them to be fitter."
    
    Despite their fast start, with Marcus Rashford scoring after just 81 seconds, United soon settled into a familiar pattern and found themselves exposed far too easily when Ipswich countered.
    
    "Amorim will be looking at this group of players and already thinking that some of them will not be here in a few months time," added former Premier League midfielder Don Hutchison. "He knows he will need to move a lot of these players on.
    
    "But you can understand and see what he wants to do in the future."

Ian Wright delivers 'perfect' Man United prediction with Ruben Amorim transfer claim

Ian Wright has explained why [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) could still qualify for Europe in Ruben Amorim's first season as the club's head coach.

Amorim was appointed as United boss earlier this month following the departure of [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The 39-year-old took charge of his first match at the weekend which saw the Reds held to a 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) was appointed as United boss with the club well adrift of the top four spots, and currently find themselves in 12th place after the stalemate at Portman Road. Six points separate United from fourth, while the Reds are only three behind Tottenham Hotspur in sixth place.

It's sixth spot that Wright believes is the most likely position for United to finish this season, which would see the club qualify for Europe in the process. The former [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) striker believes that Amorim will enjoy success at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) after several new signings are added to the squad.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

"Because [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were 14th when it was all happening and he's coming in, he gives me the impression of someone that has been given time - 'Just do your stuff and play your football'," said Wright on The Kelly & Wrighty Show for [Optus Sport](https://sport.optus.com.au/epl/videos/os83772/os83772-the-kelly-and-wrighty-show).

"That's his formation, he said that when he took the job - 'That's how I know how to play and that's how we're going to play'.

"I believe once he gets his players in and they start getting it, it is a free hit against these teams for the rest of this season because Manchester United were in 14th!

"Whatever he gets from the end of this season is only going to stand him in good stead for the summer because if it does finish well for him, they're going to probably give him whatever he wants.

"For this season, if Manchester United can blast themselves up into sixth and all that, it's perfect for what they're doing with a new manager. Sixth, easy!"

Ian Wright delivers 'perfect' Man United prediction with Ruben Amorim transfer claim
====================================================================================

Latest Manchester United news and gossip as Ian Wright makes a Premier League prediction for United in Ruben Amorim's first season
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![Image 1: Ian Wright](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30346294.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ian-Wright.jpg)

Ian Wright has made a claim about Manchester United (Image: Getty)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ian Wright has explained why [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) could still qualify for Europe in Ruben Amorim's first season as the club's head coach.

Amorim was appointed as United boss earlier this month following the departure of [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The 39-year-old took charge of his first match at the weekend which saw the Reds held to a 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) was appointed as United boss with the club well adrift of the top four spots, and currently find themselves in 12th place after the stalemate at Portman Road. Six points separate United from fourth, while the Reds are only three behind Tottenham Hotspur in sixth place.

It's sixth spot that Wright believes is the most likely position for United to finish this season, which would see the club qualify for Europe in the process. The former [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) striker believes that Amorim will enjoy success at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) after several new signings are added to the squad.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

"Because [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were 14th when it was all happening and he's coming in, he gives me the impression of someone that has been given time - 'Just do your stuff and play your football'," said Wright on The Kelly & Wrighty Show for [Optus Sport](https://sport.optus.com.au/epl/videos/os83772/os83772-the-kelly-and-wrighty-show).

"That's his formation, he said that when he took the job - 'That's how I know how to play and that's how we're going to play'.

"I believe once he gets his players in and they start getting it, it is a free hit against these teams for the rest of this season because Manchester United were in 14th!

"Whatever he gets from the end of this season is only going to stand him in good stead for the summer because if it does finish well for him, they're going to probably give him whatever he wants.

"For this season, if Manchester United can blast themselves up into sixth and all that, it's perfect for what they're doing with a new manager. Sixth, easy!"

Ian Wright delivers 'perfect' Man United prediction with Ruben Amorim transfer claim
====================================================================================

Latest Manchester United news and gossip as Ian Wright makes a Premier League prediction for United in Ruben Amorim's first season
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share

*   [Comments1](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ian-wright-delivers-easy-man-30457412#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Mark Wakefield](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/mark-wakefield/)

*   04:30, 27 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ian Wright](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30346294.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ian-Wright.jpg)

Ian Wright has made a claim about Manchester United (Image: Getty)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ian Wright has explained why [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) could still qualify for Europe in Ruben Amorim's first season as the club's head coach.

Amorim was appointed as United boss earlier this month following the departure of [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The 39-year-old took charge of his first match at the weekend which saw the Reds held to a 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) was appointed as United boss with the club well adrift of the top four spots, and currently find themselves in 12th place after the stalemate at Portman Road. Six points separate United from fourth, while the Reds are only three behind Tottenham Hotspur in sixth place.

It's sixth spot that Wright believes is the most likely position for United to finish this season, which would see the club qualify for Europe in the process. The former [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) striker believes that Amorim will enjoy success at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) after several new signings are added to the squad.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

"Because [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were 14th when it was all happening and he's coming in, he gives me the impression of someone that has been given time - 'Just do your stuff and play your football'," said Wright on The Kelly & Wrighty Show for [Optus Sport](https://sport.optus.com.au/epl/videos/os83772/os83772-the-kelly-and-wrighty-show).

"That's his formation, he said that when he took the job - 'That's how I know how to play and that's how we're going to play'.

"I believe once he gets his players in and they start getting it, it is a free hit against these teams for the rest of this season because Manchester United were in 14th!

"Whatever he gets from the end of this season is only going to stand him in good stead for the summer because if it does finish well for him, they're going to probably give him whatever he wants.

"For this season, if Manchester United can blast themselves up into sixth and all that, it's perfect for what they're doing with a new manager. Sixth, easy!"

Ian Wright delivers 'perfect' Man United prediction with Ruben Amorim transfer claim
====================================================================================

Latest Manchester United news and gossip as Ian Wright makes a Premier League prediction for United in Ruben Amorim's first season
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments1](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ian-wright-delivers-easy-man-30457412#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Mark Wakefield](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/mark-wakefield/)

*   04:30, 27 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ian Wright](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30346294.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ian-Wright.jpg)

Ian Wright has made a claim about Manchester United (Image: Getty)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ian Wright has explained why [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) could still qualify for Europe in Ruben Amorim's first season as the club's head coach.

Amorim was appointed as United boss earlier this month following the departure of [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The 39-year-old took charge of his first match at the weekend which saw the Reds held to a 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) was appointed as United boss with the club well adrift of the top four spots, and currently find themselves in 12th place after the stalemate at Portman Road. Six points separate United from fourth, while the Reds are only three behind Tottenham Hotspur in sixth place.

It's sixth spot that Wright believes is the most likely position for United to finish this season, which would see the club qualify for Europe in the process. The former [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) striker believes that Amorim will enjoy success at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) after several new signings are added to the squad.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

"Because [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were 14th when it was all happening and he's coming in, he gives me the impression of someone that has been given time - 'Just do your stuff and play your football'," said Wright on The Kelly & Wrighty Show for [Optus Sport](https://sport.optus.com.au/epl/videos/os83772/os83772-the-kelly-and-wrighty-show).

"That's his formation, he said that when he took the job - 'That's how I know how to play and that's how we're going to play'.

"I believe once he gets his players in and they start getting it, it is a free hit against these teams for the rest of this season because Manchester United were in 14th!

"Whatever he gets from the end of this season is only going to stand him in good stead for the summer because if it does finish well for him, they're going to probably give him whatever he wants.

"For this season, if Manchester United can blast themselves up into sixth and all that, it's perfect for what they're doing with a new manager. Sixth, easy!"

**_Manchester United are keen on Wolves wing-back Rayan Ait-Nouri, but face competition for Chelsea striker Christopher Nkunku, Newcastle may need to sell before pursuing move for Bournemouth's Antoine Semenyo._**

New **Manchester United** manager Ruben Amorim is keen on **Wolves'** 23-year-old Algeria wing-back, Rayan Ait-Nouri. [(Sun), external](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/31913903/man-utd-amorim-transfer-wolves-ait-nouri/)

The Red Devils are also interested in **Chelsea's** Christopher Nkunku but could face competition from **Borussia** **Dortmund** for the 27-year-old France forward. [(Teamtalk), external](https://www.teamtalk.com/news/man-utd-transfers-rival-dortmund-frustrated-chelsea-ace-perfect-ruben-amorim-signing-sources)

**Newcastle** are interested in **Bournemouth's** 24-year-old Ghana forward Antoine Semenyo but are unlikely to make a January move unless other players leave. [(Sky Sports), external](https://www.skysports.com/football/live-blog/11095/13025496/newcastle-transfer-news-rumours-and-gossip-live-updates-and-latest-on-deals-signings-loans-and-contracts?postid=8677197#liveblog-body)

**Fulham** and **Leicester** are eyeing a loan deal in January for **Brighton's** 20-year-old Republic of Ireland striker, Evan Ferguson. [(Football Insider), external](https://www.footballinsider247.com/exclusive-fulham-and-leicester-city-set-sights-on-evan-ferguson-deal/)

**Manchester City** are not looking to take advantage of a buy-back clause to bring English striker Liam Delap, 21, from **Ipswich**. [(Give Me Sport), external](https://www.givemesport.com/manchester-city-transfer-news-not-interested-triggering-delap-buyback-clause-etihad-stadium/)

**Everton** boss Sean Dyche has the full backing of current owner Farhad Moshiri and will be in charge for the foreseeable future. [(Sky Sports), external](https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11671/13260156/everton-reporter-notebook-sean-dyche-has-full-backing-of-current-ownership-despite-fan-discontent)

**Manchester United** have enquired about **Sporting's** 17-year-old Portugal U21s winger Geovany Quenda, who is valued at 60m euros (£50.1m). [(A Bola - in Portuguese), external](https://www.abola.pt/futebol/noticias/euro60-m-mais-bonus-para-o-man-united-levar-quenda-do-sporting-2024112422534275437)

The Red Devils are also targeting a number of strikers, with **PSG's** 25-year-old France international Randal Kolo Muani and **Eintracht Frankfurt's** Egypt forward Omar Marmoush, 25, on the club's radar. [(Sky Germany - in German), external](https://sport.sky.de/transfer/news/34132/13260554/marmoush-boniface-davies-transfer-themen-bei-manchester-united)

**United** are monitoring **Wolves'** 25-year-old Brazil forward Matheus Cunha, with **Tottenham** also showing interest. [(TBR Football), external](https://tbrfootball.com/what-wolves-have-told-gary-oneil-about-matheus-cunha-as-man-united-and-tottenham-circle-ahead-of-january/)

**AC Milan** are set to rival **Newcastle** for the signing of **Everton's** 27-year-old England striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin, while **Real Madrid** are considering a move for the Toffees' England defender Jarrad Branthwaite, 22. [(Teamtalk), external](https://www.teamtalk.com/news/everton-transfers-ac-milan-battle-newcastle-star-team-mate-concrete-real-madrid-target-sources)

**Manchester City** are confident Norway striker Erling Haaland, 24, will follow manager Pep Guardiola in signing a new contract with the club. [(Give Me Sport), external](https://www.givemesport.com/manchester-city-transfer-news-increasingly-confident-haaland-agree-deal-etihad-stadium/)

**Barcelona** are eyeing a 70m euro (£58.4m) deal for **Sporting Lisbon's** 26-year-old Sweden striker, Viktor Gyokeres. [(Sport - in Spanish), external](https://www.sport.es/es/noticias/barca/formula-barca-fichar-gyoekeres-112041417)

**Brighton** are to take **Cork** **City's** 17-year-old Ireland Under-18s winger Matthew Murray on trial. [(Irish Mirror), external](https://www.irishmirror.ie/sport/soccer/soccer-news/brighton-take-highly-rated-cork-34185391)

**Nottingham Forest** are confident they will agree a new contract with 28-year-old Nigeria full-back Ola Aina. [(Football Insider), external](https://www.footballinsider247.com/nottingham-forest-confident-of-agreeing-ola-aina-deal-sources/)

**PSG's** 29-year-old Slovakia defender **Milan Skriniar** is set to join Juventus in the January transfer window. [(Foot Mercato - in French), external](https://www.footmercato.net/a5501618204879572456-psg-milan-skriniar-a-donne-son-accord-a-la-juventus)

Tottenham may look to sign a goalkeeper in January after Italy's Guglielmo Vicario, 28, suffered a broken ankle that required surgery. [(Telegraph - subscription required), external](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/25/tottenham-transfer-news-vicario-injury-keeper-january/)

Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his Manchester United plan
==============================================================================================

Man United head coach Ruben Amorim will have learnt a lot from his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town on Sunday.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By

*   12:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim cuts a frustrated figure after Manchester United's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453263.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664290.jpg)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Today (Tuesday) marks exactly a year to the day since Kobbie Mainoo made his first Premier League start, starring in a 3-0 win for Manchester United over Everton at Goodison Park.

The midfielder had missed the start of the season after suffering an ankle injury in pre-season, and after three appearances on the bench, former United manager [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) made the decision to unleash him from the start against the Toffees.

That particular trip to Merseyside will always be remembered most for [Alejandro Garnacho's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/alejandro-garnacho) stunning acrobatic effort just three minutes in. However, Mainoo's performance was as equally impressive.

**READ MORE:** **[United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761)**

**READ MORE:** **['Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462)**

Sitting at the base of the midfield, the then-18-year-old bossed proceedings, leaving almost everyone watching in awe of just how accomplished he looked. You would have been forgiven for thinking he was making his 100th [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) start and not his first.

His performance at Goodison Park meant he immediately became a mainstay in Ten Hag's plans; he started 23 of [United's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) 25 remaining Premier League matches last season. He is a generational talent and United have incredibly high hopes for him.

However, the midfielder, after overcoming a six-week absence due to a muscle injury, was not deemed ready to make [Ruben Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) first United starting XI at Portman Road on Sunday. He was named on the bench alongside fellow midfielders Manuel Ugarte and Mason Mount.

Of that midfield trio, [Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo) was the only member of it not to step off the bench. But after several weeks on the sidelines, United are well within their rights not to rush his return.

But the fact he made the matchday squad has to be considered as a positive. He could make his first appearance of the Amorim era when Bodo/Glimt visit Old Trafford in the Europa League on Thursday night.

Amorim started with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in the centre of midfield on Sunday, supported by Diogo Dalot and [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo) in the two wing-back roles. Eriksen and Casemiro, who helped form United's strongest midfield in 2022/23, have a combined age of 64.

  

![Image 3: Casemiro plays a pass to ease pressure from Ipswich Town ace Omari Hutchinson.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453145.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2186660711.jpg)

Casemiro started in a two-man midfield against Ipswich Town. (Image: Zohaib Alam - MUFC/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

What quickly became clear during Amorim's debut in the dugout, as expected, was that he wants United to play with energy and aggression. He wants his team to press high up the pitch and move the ball with both speed and purpose.

As experienced as both Casemiro and Eriksen are, they are unlikely to remain starters under Amorim. They have both enjoyed outstanding careers, but they are now each at a juncture where all they can offer is a short-term solution.

That fear was highlighted during Jamie Carragher's analysis of United's performance at Ipswich on _Monday Night Football,_ where he highlighted a point in the first half when Amorim was animated with Casemiro for not pressing higher up the pitch. Carragher argued the Brazilian did not appear to be comfortable with moving out of his natural habitat as a midfield destroyer in the No.6 berth.

By the time Mainoo turns 20 in April, Casemiro will have already celebrated his 33rd birthday, likewise Eriksen. Mainoo is 13 years their junior and will naturally have more energy in the tank.

The United academy graduate is a forward-thinking, progressive midfielder, who has the legs to get around the pitch much quicker. He can also move the ball faster and help United break the lines.

Had Mainoo not spent several weeks on the sidelines prior to Amorim's appointment, the chances are he would have started in Suffolk. The same could be said for Ugarte, who was away with Uruguay on international duty last week and only had two training sessions prior to the trip to Ipswich.

  

![Image 4: Kobbie Mainoo and Manuel Ugarte track the run of Crystal Palace midfielder Will Hughes.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30415719.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2173571204.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo (left) and Manuel Ugarte (right) have only started one game together for Manchester United. (Image: Harriet Lander/Getty Images.)

The general expectation is that Mainoo and Ugarte will end up forming Amorim's first-choice midfield. It is a combination that has the potential to become a long-term partnership.

Mainoo and Ugarte both have the legs and the energy required to press man-for-man. Amorim is evidently hungry for United to show more energy than what they have done so far this season.

As well as being happy to press, Mainoo can also add a turn of speed and athleticism to United's midfield, enabling them to progress the ball quicker. That particular trait was missing at Portman Road.

Without even playing a single minute under Amorim thus far, Mainoo's omission on Sunday highlighted just how important he could be. He could quite easily form the pillar of Amorim's vision.

data: {"title":"Ruben Amorim may have already found his most important player for his plan","description":"Man United head coach Ruben Amorim will have learnt a lot from his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town on Sunday.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668","content":"Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his Manchester United plan - George Smith - Manchester Evening News
=============== 

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his Manchester United plan
==============================================================================================

Man United head coach Ruben Amorim will have learnt a lot from his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town on Sunday.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments6](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   12:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim cuts a frustrated figure after Manchester United's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453263.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664290.jpg)

Ruben Amorim will want to see more from his players as the weeks go by. (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Today (Tuesday) marks exactly a year to the day since Kobbie Mainoo made his first Premier League start, starring in a 3-0 win for Manchester United over Everton at Goodison Park.

The midfielder had missed the start of the season after suffering an ankle injury in pre-season, and after three appearances on the bench, former United manager [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) made the decision to unleash him from the start against the Toffees.

That particular trip to Merseyside will always be remembered most for [Alejandro Garnacho's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/alejandro-garnacho) stunning acrobatic effort just three minutes in. However, Mainoo's performance was as equally impressive.

**READ MORE:** **[United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761)**

**READ MORE:** **['Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462)**

Sitting at the base of the midfield, the then-18-year-old bossed proceedings, leaving almost everyone watching in awe of just how accomplished he looked. You would have been forgiven for thinking he was making his 100th [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) start and not his first.

His performance at Goodison Park meant he immediately became a mainstay in Ten Hag's plans; he started 23 of [United's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) 25 remaining Premier League matches last season. He is a generational talent and United have incredibly high hopes for him.

However, the midfielder, after overcoming a six-week absence due to a muscle injury, was not deemed ready to make [Ruben Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) first United starting XI at Portman Road on Sunday. He was named on the bench alongside fellow midfielders Manuel Ugarte and Mason Mount.

Of that midfield trio, [Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo) was the only member of it not to step off the bench. But after several weeks on the sidelines, United are well within their rights not to rush his return.

But the fact he made the matchday squad has to be considered as a positive. He could make his first appearance of the Amorim era when Bodo/Glimt visit Old Trafford in the Europa League on Thursday night.

Amorim started with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in the centre of midfield on Sunday, supported by Diogo Dalot and [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo) in the two wing-back roles. Eriksen and Casemiro, who helped form United's strongest midfield in 2022/23, have a combined age of 64.

  

![Image 3: Casemiro plays a pass to ease pressure from Ipswich Town ace Omari Hutchinson.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453145.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2186660711.jpg)

Casemiro started in a two-man midfield against Ipswich Town. (Image: Zohaib Alam - MUFC/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

What quickly became clear during Amorim's debut in the dugout, as expected, was that he wants United to play with energy and aggression. He wants his team to press high up the pitch and move the ball with both speed and purpose.

As experienced as both Casemiro and Eriksen are, they are unlikely to remain starters under Amorim. They have both enjoyed outstanding careers, but they are now each at a juncture where all they can offer is a short-term solution.

That fear was highlighted during Jamie Carragher's analysis of United's performance at Ipswich on _Monday Night Football,_ where he highlighted a point in the first half when Amorim was animated with Casemiro for not pressing higher up the pitch. Carragher argued the Brazilian did not appear to be comfortable with moving out of his natural habitat as a midfield destroyer in the No.6 berth.

By the time Mainoo turns 20 in April, Casemiro will have already celebrated his 33rd birthday, likewise Eriksen. Mainoo is 13 years their junior and will naturally have more energy in the tank.

The United academy graduate is a forward-thinking, progressive midfielder, who has the legs to get around the pitch much quicker. He can also move the ball faster and help United break the lines.

Had Mainoo not spent several weeks on the sidelines prior to Amorim's appointment, the chances are he would have started in Suffolk. The same could be said for Ugarte, who was away with Uruguay on international duty last week and only had two training sessions prior to the trip to Ipswich.

  

![Image 4: Kobbie Mainoo and Manuel Ugarte track the run of Crystal Palace midfielder Will Hughes.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30415719.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2173571204.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo (left) and Manuel Ugarte (right) have only started one game together for Manchester United. (Image: Harriet Lander/Getty Images.)

The general expectation is that Mainoo and Ugarte will end up forming Amorim's first-choice midfield. It is a combination that has the potential to become a long-term partnership.

Mainoo and Ugarte both have the legs and the energy required to press man-for-man. Amorim is evidently hungry for United to show more energy than what they have done so far this season.

As well as being happy to press, Mainoo can also add a turn of speed and athleticism to United's midfield, enabling them to progress the ball quicker. That particular trait was missing at Portman Road.

Without even playing a single minute under Amorim thus far, Mainoo's omission on Sunday highlighted just how important he could be. He could quite easily form the pillar of Amorim's vision.

data: {"title":"Ruben Amorim may have already found his most important player for his plan","description":"Man United head coach Ruben Amorim will have learnt a lot from his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town on Sunday.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668","content":"Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his Manchester United plan - George Smith - Manchester Evening News
=============== 

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his Manchester United plan
==============================================================================================

Man United head coach Ruben Amorim will have learnt a lot from his debut in the dugout against Ipswich Town on Sunday.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments6](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   12:00, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim cuts a frustrated figure after Manchester United's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453263.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664290.jpg)

Ruben Amorim will want to see more from his players as the weeks go by. (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Today (Tuesday) marks exactly a year to the day since Kobbie Mainoo made his first Premier League start, starring in a 3-0 win for Manchester United over Everton at Goodison Park.

The midfielder had missed the start of the season after suffering an ankle injury in pre-season, and after three appearances on the bench, former United manager [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) made the decision to unleash him from the start against the Toffees.

That particular trip to Merseyside will always be remembered most for [Alejandro Garnacho's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/alejandro-garnacho) stunning acrobatic effort just three minutes in. However, Mainoo's performance was as equally impressive.

**READ MORE:** **[United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761)**

**READ MORE:** **['Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462)**

Sitting at the base of the midfield, the then-18-year-old bossed proceedings, leaving almost everyone watching in awe of just how accomplished he looked. You would have been forgiven for thinking he was making his 100th [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) start and not his first.

His performance at Goodison Park meant he immediately became a mainstay in Ten Hag's plans; he started 23 of [United's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) 25 remaining Premier League matches last season. He is a generational talent and United have incredibly high hopes for him.

However, the midfielder, after overcoming a six-week absence due to a muscle injury, was not deemed ready to make [Ruben Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) first United starting XI at Portman Road on Sunday. He was named on the bench alongside fellow midfielders Manuel Ugarte and Mason Mount.

Of that midfield trio, [Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo) was the only member of it not to step off the bench. But after several weeks on the sidelines, United are well within their rights not to rush his return.

But the fact he made the matchday squad has to be considered as a positive. He could make his first appearance of the Amorim era when Bodo/Glimt visit Old Trafford in the Europa League on Thursday night.

Amorim started with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in the centre of midfield on Sunday, supported by Diogo Dalot and [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo) in the two wing-back roles. Eriksen and Casemiro, who helped form United's strongest midfield in 2022/23, have a combined age of 64.

  

![Image 3: Casemiro plays a pass to ease pressure from Ipswich Town ace Omari Hutchinson.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453145.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2186660711.jpg)

Casemiro started in a two-man midfield against Ipswich Town. (Image: Zohaib Alam - MUFC/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

What quickly became clear during Amorim's debut in the dugout, as expected, was that he wants United to play with energy and aggression. He wants his team to press high up the pitch and move the ball with both speed and purpose.

As experienced as both Casemiro and Eriksen are, they are unlikely to remain starters under Amorim. They have both enjoyed outstanding careers, but they are now each at a juncture where all they can offer is a short-term solution.

That fear was highlighted during Jamie Carragher's analysis of United's performance at Ipswich on _Monday Night Football,_ where he highlighted a point in the first half when Amorim was animated with Casemiro for not pressing higher up the pitch. Carragher argued the Brazilian did not appear to be comfortable with moving out of his natural habitat as a midfield destroyer in the No.6 berth.

By the time Mainoo turns 20 in April, Casemiro will have already celebrated his 33rd birthday, likewise Eriksen. Mainoo is 13 years their junior and will naturally have more energy in the tank.

The United academy graduate is a forward-thinking, progressive midfielder, who has the legs to get around the pitch much quicker. He can also move the ball faster and help United break the lines.

Had Mainoo not spent several weeks on the sidelines prior to Amorim's appointment, the chances are he would have started in Suffolk. The same could be said for Ugarte, who was away with Uruguay on international duty last week and only had two training sessions prior to the trip to Ipswich.

  

![Image 4: Kobbie Mainoo and Manuel Ugarte track the run of Crystal Palace midfielder Will Hughes.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30415719.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2173571204.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo (left) and Manuel Ugarte (right) have only started one game together for Manchester United. (Image: Harriet Lander/Getty Images.)

The general expectation is that Mainoo and Ugarte will end up forming Amorim's first-choice midfield. It is a combination that has the potential to become a long-term partnership.

Mainoo and Ugarte both have the legs and the energy required to press man-for-man. Amorim is evidently hungry for United to show more energy than what they have done so far this season.

As well as being happy to press, Mainoo can also add a turn of speed and athleticism to United's midfield, enabling them to progress the ball quicker. That particular trait was missing at Portman Road.

Without even playing a single minute under Amorim thus far, Mainoo's omission on Sunday highlighted just how important he could be. He could quite easily form the pillar of Amorim's vision.

==============================================================================================

Today (Tuesday) marks exactly a year to the day since Kobbie Mainoo made his first Premier League start, starring in a 3-0 win for Manchester United over Everton at Goodison Park.

The midfielder had missed the start of the season after suffering an ankle injury in pre-season, and after three appearances on the bench, former United manager [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) made the decision to unleash him from the start against the Toffees.

That particular trip to Merseyside will always be remembered most for [Alejandro Garnacho's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/alejandro-garnacho) stunning acrobatic effort just three minutes in. However, Mainoo's performance was as equally impressive.

**READ MORE:** **[United undroppable might need new role when £52m gem is finally unleashed](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-undroppable-might-need-30448761)**

**READ MORE:** **['Adaptable' - Gary Neville names four United players who will be key for Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adaptable-gary-neville-names-four-30452462)**

Sitting at the base of the midfield, the then-18-year-old bossed proceedings, leaving almost everyone watching in awe of just how accomplished he looked. You would have been forgiven for thinking he was making his 100th [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) start and not his first.

His performance at Goodison Park meant he immediately became a mainstay in Ten Hag's plans; he started 23 of [United's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) 25 remaining Premier League matches last season. He is a generational talent and United have incredibly high hopes for him.

However, the midfielder, after overcoming a six-week absence due to a muscle injury, was not deemed ready to make [Ruben Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) first United starting XI at Portman Road on Sunday. He was named on the bench alongside fellow midfielders Manuel Ugarte and Mason Mount.

Of that midfield trio, [Mainoo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kobbie-mainoo) was the only member of it not to step off the bench. But after several weeks on the sidelines, United are well within their rights not to rush his return.

But the fact he made the matchday squad has to be considered as a positive. He could make his first appearance of the Amorim era when Bodo/Glimt visit Old Trafford in the Europa League on Thursday night.

Amorim started with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in the centre of midfield on Sunday, supported by Diogo Dalot and [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo) in the two wing-back roles. Eriksen and Casemiro, who helped form United's strongest midfield in 2022/23, have a combined age of 64.

  

![Image 64: Casemiro plays a pass to ease pressure from Ipswich Town ace Omari Hutchinson.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30453145.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2186660711.jpg)

Casemiro started in a two-man midfield against Ipswich Town. (Image: Zohaib Alam - MUFC/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

What quickly became clear during Amorim's debut in the dugout, as expected, was that he wants United to play with energy and aggression. He wants his team to press high up the pitch and move the ball with both speed and purpose.

As experienced as both Casemiro and Eriksen are, they are unlikely to remain starters under Amorim. They have both enjoyed outstanding careers, but they are now each at a juncture where all they can offer is a short-term solution.

That fear was highlighted during Jamie Carragher's analysis of United's performance at Ipswich on _Monday Night Football,_ where he highlighted a point in the first half when Amorim was animated with Casemiro for not pressing higher up the pitch. Carragher argued the Brazilian did not appear to be comfortable with moving out of his natural habitat as a midfield destroyer in the No.6 berth.

By the time Mainoo turns 20 in April, Casemiro will have already celebrated his 33rd birthday, likewise Eriksen. Mainoo is 13 years their junior and will naturally have more energy in the tank.

The United academy graduate is a forward-thinking, progressive midfielder, who has the legs to get around the pitch much quicker. He can also move the ball faster and help United break the lines.

Had Mainoo not spent several weeks on the sidelines prior to Amorim's appointment, the chances are he would have started in Suffolk. The same could be said for Ugarte, who was away with Uruguay on international duty last week and only had two training sessions prior to the trip to Ipswich.

  

![Image 65: Kobbie Mainoo and Manuel Ugarte track the run of Crystal Palace midfielder Will Hughes.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30415719.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2173571204.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo (left) and Manuel Ugarte (right) have only started one game together for Manchester United. (Image: Harriet Lander/Getty Images.)

The general expectation is that Mainoo and Ugarte will end up forming Amorim's first-choice midfield. It is a combination that has the potential to become a long-term partnership.

Mainoo and Ugarte both have the legs and the energy required to press man-for-man. Amorim is evidently hungry for United to show more energy than what they have done so far this season.

As well as being happy to press, Mainoo can also add a turn of speed and athleticism to United's midfield, enabling them to progress the ball quicker. That particular trait was missing at Portman Road.

Without even playing a single minute under Amorim thus far, Mainoo's omission on Sunday highlighted just how important he could be. He could quite easily form the pillar of Amorim's vision.

Latest updates
--------------

1.  **Simon Stone**  
    Chief football news reporter
    
    New Manchester United coach Ruben Amorim has an unusual way of singling out players when he is making generic points.
    
    He did it on Sunday when he spoke about his players having difficulties adapting to his new system, pointing to an instance when Jonny Evans found himself in the wrong place. Today in his news conference, Amorim explained he was using Evans to emphasise the point he was making rather than being critical.
    
    A couple of answers later, he was talking about players needing to score goals and said Amad Diallo needs to be better at it. This is good, but it is also a bit dangerous because at some point the subtlety might be lost and it will come across as a direct criticism, which it isn't. Then, it will turn into a storm he then has to deal with when he next speaks to the media.

2.  **Josh Lobley**  
    BBC Sport Journalist
    
    Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim has been speaking to the media before Thursday's Europa League game against Bodo/Glimt. Here are the key lines from his news conference:
    
    *   He was asked if Harry Maguire and Lisandro Martinez will be available for Thursday's match: "Not Harry. Lisandro is ready. I felt he's had enough time so he is ready. Harry will be ready soon and on the pitch also."
    
3.  **Pat Nevin**  
    Former footballer and presenter
    
    After Liverpool's win at Southampton, all eyes shifted to the real story on Sunday. Ruben Amorim’s first decisions as Manchester United coach are as much discussed in the UK as Donald Trump’s White House cabinet selections attract attention over the pond. Certainly, United now have a plan, but whether it is a good one that suits the players is less certain. The identity of a harder working, energetic side has already been demanded by the new coach. The suspicion is that he will need a lot of action in the transfer market rather than the training ground to achieve this.
    
4.  **Dale O'Donnell**  
    Fan writer
    
    Amad Diallo has been working his way into Manchester United’s plans, but now is the time for the winger to stake his importance to Ruben Amorim. Last Sunday, we saw Amad deployed as one of two wing-back options in the 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town. Amorim had just two training sessions with his matchday squad to prepare his players for their first game. The Portuguese coach wasted no time implementing his preferred 3-4-3 formation, with Diogo Dalot named as the opposite wing-back...
    
This is good, but it is also a bit dangerous because at some point the subtlety might be lost and it will come across as a direct criticism, which it isn't. Then, it will turn into a storm he then has to deal with when he next speaks to the media.
    
When I watch United, I want our wide players hurting teams down the flanks, and Amad has the energy to be a threat throughout games. That is why Amorim will have a place for the 22-year-old.
